---
description: CursorToys - VS Code/Cursor Extension
alwaysApply: true
applyTo: "**"
version: 1.6.0
---

# CursorToys
CursorToys is a VS Code/Cursor extension that transforms Cursor AI into a collaborative productivity powerhouse. It provides utilities for sharing AI configurations, testing APIs, managing personal libraries, and enhancing team collaboration.

- [CursorToys GitHub](https://github.com/CursorToys/cursor-toys)
- [VS Code Marketplace](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=Godrix.cursor-toys)
- [Open VSX Registry](https://open-vsx.org/extension/godrix/cursor-toys)

## Installation

### VS Code Marketplace (Recommended)
1. Open Extensions (`Cmd+Shift+X` / `Ctrl+Shift+X`)
2. Search for **"Cursor Command Toys"**
3. Click Install

### Manual Installation via VSIX
1. Download the latest `.vsix` from [GitHub Releases](https://github.com/CursorToys/cursor-toys/releases)
2. Open Command Palette (`Cmd+Shift+P` / `Ctrl+Shift+P`)
3. Run **"Extensions: Install from VSIX..."**
4. Select the downloaded file

### Development/Local Build
```bash
git clone https://github.com/CursorToys/cursor-toys.git
cd cursor-toys
npm install
npm run compile
npm run package
```

## Core Features

### 1. Instant Sharing
Share AI configurations (commands, rules, prompts, skills, hooks, plans, notepads) with one click.

**Supported Formats:**
- **Deeplink**: `cursor://godrix.cursor-toys/command?name=...&text=...` (traditional format, 8KB limit)
- **CursorToys Format**: `cursortoys://COMMAND:filename:compressedData` (compressed format, no size limit)
- **Web URL**: `https://cursor.com/link/...` (web-based deeplink)
- **GitHub Gist**: Share via Gist for maximum compatibility and browser viewing

**How to Share:**
1. Right-click on any file in `.cursor/commands/`, `.cursor/rules/`, `.cursor/prompts/`, `.cursor/skills/`, etc.
2. Select "CursorToys: Share as Deeplink" or "CursorToys: Share as CursorToys"
3. Link is copied to clipboard automatically

**How to Import:**
1. Press `Cmd+Shift+I` (Mac) or `Ctrl+Shift+I` (Windows/Linux)
2. Paste deeplink, CursorToys shareable, or GitHub Gist URL
3. Choose Personal (available across all projects) or Project (workspace-specific) location
4. File is created automatically in the appropriate folder

**CodeLens Integration:**
- Files show clickable "Share as Deeplink" and "Share as CursorToys" links at the top
- Click directly in the editor to generate shareable links

### 2. In-Editor API Testing
Test HTTP requests without leaving Cursor/VS Code.

**File Location:**
- Create `.req` or `.request` files in `.cursor/http/` folder (or `.vscode/http/` if using VS Code)

**Supported Formats:**
- **cURL Commands**: Full cURL syntax support
- **REST Client Format**: `METHOD URL` with headers and body (similar to VS Code REST Client extension)

**Multiple Requests:**
- Use markdown sections (`## Section Title`) to organize multiple requests in one file
- Each section gets its own "Send Request" CodeLens link

**Example cURL Format:**
```http
## Get All Users
curl --request GET \
  --url https://api.example.com/users \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer {{API_KEY}}'
```

**Example REST Client Format:**
```http
### Get All Users
GET {{BASE_URL}}/api/users
Authorization: Bearer {{API_KEY}}

### Create User
POST {{BASE_URL}}/api/users
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "name": "John Doe",
  "email": "john@example.com"
}
```

**Environment Variables:**
- Store variables in `.cursor/http/.environments/` folder (or `environments/`, `__environments__/`, `_env/`)
- Files: `.env`, `.env.dev`, `.env.staging`, `.env.prod`, etc.
- Use `{{variableName}}` syntax in requests
- Switch environments via Command Palette: "CursorToys: Select HTTP Environment"
- Status bar shows current active environment

**Inline Variables:**
- Define variables directly in request files: `# @var VAR_NAME=value`
- Global variables (before first `##` section) apply to all sections
- Section-specific variables override global variables
- Cascading behavior: section variables inherit from previous section or global

**Helper Functions:**
- `{{@prompt("label")}}` - Prompt user for input value
- `{{@randomIn(min, max)}}` - Generate random integer
- `{{@datetime}}` or `{{@datetime("format")}}` - Current date/time
- `{{@uuid()}}` - Generate random UUID v4
- `{{@randomString(length)}}` - Generate random alphanumeric string

**Environment Decorators:**
- Use `# @env environmentName` before sections to specify environment
- Cascading: section-specific → previous section → global
- Example:
```http
# @env prod

## Request 1
GET {{BASE_URL}}/api/users
# Uses 'prod' environment

# @env dev
## Request 2
POST {{BASE_URL}}/api/users
# Uses 'dev' environment (explicit)

## Request 3
GET {{BASE_URL}}/api/posts
# Uses 'dev' environment (inherited from previous section)
```

**Response Handling:**
- Responses saved to `.res` or `.response` files (or preview-only mode)
- Automatic JSON and XML formatting
- Execution time displayed in response tab title
- Syntax highlighting for both request and response files

**Configuration:**
- `cursorToys.httpRequestTimeout`: Timeout in seconds (default: 10)
- `cursorToys.httpRequestSaveFile`: Save response to file or preview only (default: false)
- `cursorToys.httpDefaultEnvironment`: Default environment name (default: "dev")
- `cursorToys.environmentsFolder`: Folder name for environments (default: ".environments")

### 3. Personal Libraries
Build reusable libraries of commands, prompts, and skills that work across all projects.

**Personal Commands:**
- Location: `~/.cursor/commands/` or `~/.claude/commands/`
- Available across all projects
- Visual tree view in Explorer sidebar: "Commands"
- Drag-and-drop support for organizing in folders
- Context menu: Open, Share, Rename, Delete, Reveal

**Personal Prompts:**
- Location: `~/.cursor/prompts/`
- Available across all projects
- Visual tree view in Explorer sidebar: "Prompts"
- Drag-and-drop support for organizing in folders
- Context menu: Open, Share, Rename, Delete, Reveal

**Personal Skills:**
- Location: `~/.cursor/skills/` or `~/.claude/skills/`
- Each skill is a folder containing `SKILL.md` file
- Visual tree view in Explorer sidebar: "Skills"
- Hierarchical structure: Category → Skill Folder → SKILL.md
- Drag-and-drop support for organizing skills
- Context menu: Open, Share, Rename, Delete, Reveal

**Configuration:**
- `cursorToys.commandsFolder`: Choose `cursor` (default) or `claude` for commands folder
- `cursorToys.personalCommandsView`: Show `both`, `cursor`, or `claude` folders (default: both)
- `cursorToys.baseFolder`: Customize base folder name (default: "cursor")

### 4. Project Notepads
Project-specific markdown documentation that stays with your project.

**Location:**
- `.cursor/notepads/` (workspace-specific, not personal)

**Features:**
- Visual tree view in Explorer sidebar: "Notepads"
- Hierarchical folder structure with drag-and-drop
- Create, rename, delete, and share notepads
- Share individual notepads or entire folders as bundles
- Share via CursorToys format or GitHub Gist

**Use Cases:**
- Project architecture documentation
- Decision records
- Team guides and tutorials
- Project-specific notes

### 5. Cursor Hooks Management
Manage Cursor hooks configuration files for automating workflows.

**Location:**
- Personal: `~/.cursor/hooks.json` (all projects)
- Project: `workspace/.cursor/hooks.json` (workspace-specific)

**Features:**
- Visual tree view in Explorer sidebar: "Cursor Hooks"
- Shows hooks.json file and associated scripts
- Create, open, share, delete hooks files
- Share hooks via CursorToys format or GitHub Gist
- Automatic detection of hook scripts from hooks.json content

**Hooks File Structure:**
```json
{
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "hooks": {
    "onFileSave": {
      "command": "node scripts/format.js",
      "files": "**/*.{js,ts}"
    }
  }
}
```

### 6. Cursor Plans Management
Manage Cursor plan files for project planning and documentation.

**Location:**
- Personal: `~/.cursor/plans/` (all projects)
- Project: `workspace/.cursor/plans/` (workspace-specific)

**Features:**
- Visual tree view in Explorer sidebar: "Cursor Plans"
- Files must have `.plan.md` extension
- Create, open, share, rename, delete plans
- Share plans via CursorToys format or GitHub Gist
- Share plan folders as bundles

### 7. Skills Management
Complete support for Cursor Skills with visual tree view.

**Location:**
- Personal: `~/.cursor/skills/` or `~/.claude/skills/`
- Project: `workspace/.cursor/skills/` or `workspace/.claude/skills/`

**Structure:**
- Each skill is a folder containing `SKILL.md` file
- Hierarchical organization: Category → Skill Folder → SKILL.md

**Features:**
- Visual tree view in Explorer sidebar: "Skills"
- Drag-and-drop support for organizing skills
- Share individual skills via deeplink or CursorToys format
- Share skills folders as bundles
- CodeLens support for SKILL.md files
- Import skills from deeplinks and shareables

### 8. File Minification
Optimize files and clipboard content to reduce file sizes.

**Supported Formats:**
- JSON, HTML, XML, CSS, SVG, JavaScript, TypeScript

**File Minification:**
- Right-click on file → "CursorToys: Minify File"
- Or use editor title bar minify icon
- Creates minified version with configurable suffix (default: `.min`)
- Shows statistics: original size, minified size, savings percentage

**Clipboard Minification:**
- Command: "CursorToys: Trim & Minify Clipboard"
- Auto-detects content type
- Shows savings statistics
- Alternative: "CursorToys: Trim & Minify Clipboard (Select Type)" for manual type selection

**Configuration:**
- `cursorToys.minify.outputSuffix`: Suffix for minified files (default: ".min")
- `cursorToys.minify.preserveComments`: Preserve comments (future feature, default: false)

### 9. Chat Integration
Send code and text directly to Cursor chat without manual copy-paste.

**Commands:**
- `cursor-toys.sendSelectionToChat`: Send selected code to chat with file context
- `cursor-toys.sendToChat`: Send custom text to chat
- `cursor-toys.copySelectionAsPrompt`: Copy selected code as prompt deeplink with file context

**Context Menu:**
- Right-click on selected text → "Cursor Toys" submenu
- Options: "Send Selection to Chat", "Copy as Prompt Deeplink"

**Context Information:**
- File path, language, and line numbers automatically included
- Makes it easier for AI to understand code context

### 10. GitHub Gist Integration
Share files and bundles via GitHub Gist for maximum compatibility.

**Features:**
- Browser viewing without importing
- Maximum compatibility (works with any editor)
- Public or private Gist creation
- Permanent links on GitHub
- Version history tracking
- Embedded viewing in documentation

**Commands:**
- `cursor-toys.shareViaGist`: Share single file as GitHub Gist
- `cursor-toys.shareFolderViaGist`: Share entire folder as Gist bundle
- `cursor-toys.importFromGist`: Import from GitHub Gist (also works via `Cmd+Shift+I`)

**Token Management:**
- `cursor-toys.configureGitHubToken`: Configure GitHub Personal Access Token
- `cursor-toys.removeGitHubToken`: Remove stored GitHub token
- Secure token storage using VS Code Secrets API

**Configuration:**
- `cursorToys.gistDefaultVisibility`: Default visibility (`public`, `private`, or `ask`)

### 11. Smart Recommendations
AI-powered suggestions for commands, prompts, and rules based on project context.

**Features:**
- Automatic project context detection (languages, frameworks, tools)
- Marketplace browser with elegant visual interface
- Tag-based search and filtering
- Multi-select installation
- YAML frontmatter support for metadata
- Smart caching (memory and disk)

**Supported Contexts:**
- Languages: JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, Java, Go, Rust, Ruby, PHP, Elixir
- Frameworks: React, Next.js, Vue, Angular, Svelte, Express, NestJS
- Tools: Jest, Vitest, Playwright, Cypress, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform

**Commands:**
- `cursor-toys.checkRecommendations`: Check recommendations for current project
- `cursor-toys.browseRecommendations`: Open recommendations marketplace browser
- `cursor-toys.refreshRecommendations`: Clear cache and refresh recommendations

**Configuration:**
- `cursorToys.recommendationsEnabled`: Enable/disable recommendations (default: true)
- `cursorToys.recommendationsCheckOnStartup`: Check on workspace open (default: true)
- `cursorToys.recommendationsSuggestInterval`: Days between suggestions (default: 7)
- `cursorToys.recommendationsIndexUrl`: URL to remote recommendations index
- `cursorToys.recommendationsIndexGistId`: Alternative Gist ID for recommendations index

## Folder Structure

### Base Folder Configuration
The extension supports customizing the base folder name via `cursorToys.baseFolder` setting:
- Default: `cursor` (creates `.cursor/` folder)
- Options: `cursor`, `vscode`, `ai`, or any custom name
- Applies to: commands, rules, prompts, HTTP, notepads, plans, skills, hooks

**Note:** Rules and prompts are Cursor-specific features and may not work in VS Code.

### Standard Folder Structure
```
workspace/
├── .cursor/                    # Base folder (configurable)
│   ├── commands/              # Project commands
│   ├── rules/                 # Project rules (Cursor-specific)
│   ├── prompts/               # Project prompts (Cursor-specific)
│   ├── skills/                # Project skills
│   ├── hooks.json             # Project hooks
│   ├── plans/                 # Project plans
│   ├── notepads/              # Project notepads
│   └── http/                   # HTTP requests
│       ├── api.req            # Request files
│       └── .environments/     # Environment variables
│           ├── .env           # Default environment
│           ├── .env.dev       # Development environment
│           └── .env.prod      # Production environment
└── ~/.cursor/                  # Personal folder (home directory)
    ├── commands/               # Personal commands (all projects)
    ├── prompts/                # Personal prompts (all projects)
    ├── skills/                 # Personal skills (all projects)
    ├── hooks.json              # Personal hooks (all projects)
    └── plans/                 # Personal plans (all projects)
```

### Alternative Folder Structure (Claude)
If using `cursorToys.commandsFolder: "claude"`:
- Personal commands: `~/.claude/commands/`
- Project commands: `workspace/.claude/commands/`
- Personal skills: `~/.claude/skills/`
- Project skills: `workspace/.claude/skills/`

## File Types and Extensions

### Commands
- **Location**: `.cursor/commands/` or `.claude/commands/`
- **Extensions**: `.md`, `.mdc` (configurable via `cursorToys.allowedExtensions`)
- **Personal**: `~/.cursor/commands/` or `~/.claude/commands/`
- **Project**: `workspace/.cursor/commands/` or `workspace/.claude/commands/`

### Rules
- **Location**: `.cursor/rules/`
- **Extensions**: `.md`, `.mdc` (`.mdc` recommended for metadata support)
- **Note**: Cursor-specific feature, may not work in VS Code
- **Project only**: No personal rules folder

### Prompts
- **Location**: `.cursor/prompts/`
- **Extensions**: `.md`, `.mdc`
- **Note**: Cursor-specific feature, may not work in VS Code
- **Personal**: `~/.cursor/prompts/`
- **Project**: `workspace/.cursor/prompts/`

### Skills
- **Location**: `.cursor/skills/` or `.claude/skills/`
- **Structure**: Folder containing `SKILL.md` file
- **Personal**: `~/.cursor/skills/` or `~/.claude/skills/`
- **Project**: `workspace/.cursor/skills/` or `workspace/.claude/skills/`

### Hooks
- **Location**: `.cursor/hooks.json`
- **Personal**: `~/.cursor/hooks.json`
- **Project**: `workspace/.cursor/hooks.json`

### Plans
- **Location**: `.cursor/plans/`
- **Extensions**: `.plan.md` (required)
- **Personal**: `~/.cursor/plans/`
- **Project**: `workspace/.cursor/plans/`

### Notepads
- **Location**: `.cursor/notepads/`
- **Extensions**: `.md`, `.mdc`
- **Project only**: No personal notepads folder

### HTTP Requests
- **Location**: `.cursor/http/`
- **Extensions**: `.req`, `.request`
- **Project only**: No personal HTTP folder

### Environment Files
- **Location**: `.cursor/http/.environments/` (or `environments/`, `__environments__/`, `_env/`)
- **Extensions**: `.env`, `.env.*` (e.g., `.env.dev`, `.env.prod`)
- **Project only**: No personal environments folder

## Sharing Formats

### Deeplink Format
Traditional format with URL encoding:
- Protocol: `cursor://godrix.cursor-toys/` or `https://cursor.com/link/`
- Format: `cursor://godrix.cursor-toys/{type}?name={name}&text={encodedContent}`
- Size limit: 8,000 characters
- Best for: Small files, quick sharing, clickable links

### CursorToys Format
Compressed format with no size limit:
- Protocol: `cursortoys://`
- Format: `cursortoys://{TYPE}:filename:compressedData`
- Compression: Gzip + Base64 encoding
- Size reduction: 60-80% compared to URL-encoded deeplinks
- Best for: Large files, team distribution, no URL length limits

**Supported Types:**
- `COMMAND`, `RULE`, `PROMPT`, `SKILL`, `HOOKS`, `PLAN`, `NOTEPAD`
- `HTTP`, `ENV` (environment files)
- `COMMAND_BUNDLE`, `RULE_BUNDLE`, `PROMPT_BUNDLE`, `SKILL_BUNDLE`, `PLAN_BUNDLE`, `NOTEPAD_BUNDLE`
- `HTTP_BUNDLE`, `ENV_BUNDLE`, `HTTP_ENV_BUNDLE`
- `PROJECT_BUNDLE` (complete project bundle)

### GitHub Gist Format
Maximum compatibility format:
- Browser viewing without importing
- Works with any editor
- Public or private Gists
- Permanent links on GitHub
- Version history tracking

**Gist Structure:**
- Single file: One file per Gist
- Bundle: Multiple files in one Gist
- Metadata: CursorToys metadata embedded in Gist description

## Configuration Options

### Link Generation
- `cursorToys.linkType`: Type of link to generate (`deeplink`, `web`, `custom`)
- `cursorToys.customBaseUrl`: Custom base URL (only used when linkType is `custom`)

### File Extensions
- `cursorToys.allowedExtensions`: Allowed file extensions (default: `["md", "mdc"]`)

### Folder Configuration
- `cursorToys.baseFolder`: Base folder name (default: `"cursor"`)
- `cursorToys.commandsFolder`: Commands folder (`cursor` or `claude`, default: `cursor`)
- `cursorToys.personalCommandsView`: Show commands from (`both`, `cursor`, `claude`, default: `both`)
- `cursorToys.environmentsFolder`: Environments folder name (default: `".environments"`)

### HTTP Request Settings
- `cursorToys.httpRequestTimeout`: Timeout in seconds (default: `10`)
- `cursorToys.httpRequestSaveFile`: Save response to file or preview only (default: `false`)
- `cursorToys.httpDefaultEnvironment`: Default environment name (default: `"dev"`)

### Minification Settings
- `cursorToys.minify.outputSuffix`: Suffix for minified files (default: `".min"`)
- `cursorToys.minify.preserveComments`: Preserve comments (default: `false`, not yet implemented)

### GitHub Gist Settings
- `cursorToys.gistDefaultVisibility`: Default visibility (`public`, `private`, `ask`, default: `ask`)

### Recommendations Settings
- `cursorToys.recommendationsEnabled`: Enable recommendations (default: `true`)
- `cursorToys.recommendationsCheckOnStartup`: Check on workspace open (default: `true`)
- `cursorToys.recommendationsSuggestInterval`: Days between suggestions (default: `7`)
- `cursorToys.recommendationsIndexUrl`: URL to remote recommendations index
- `cursorToys.recommendationsIndexGistId`: Alternative Gist ID for recommendations index

## Commands Reference

### Sharing Commands
- `cursor-toys.generate-command`: Share as Deeplink (Command)
- `cursor-toys.generate-rule`: Share as Deeplink (Rule)
- `cursor-toys.generate-prompt`: Share as Deeplink (Prompt)
- `cursor-toys.generate-skill`: Share as Deeplink (Skill)
- `cursor-toys.shareAsCursorToysCommand`: Share as CursorToys (Command)
- `cursor-toys.shareAsCursorToysRule`: Share as CursorToys (Rule)
- `cursor-toys.shareAsCursorToysPrompt`: Share as CursorToys (Prompt)
- `cursor-toys.shareAsCursorToysSkill`: Share as CursorToys (Skill)
- `cursor-toys.shareAsCursorToysHttp`: Share as CursorToys (HTTP Request)
- `cursor-toys.shareAsCursorToysEnv`: Share as CursorToys (Environment)
- `cursor-toys.shareAsCursorToysNotepad`: Share as CursorToys (Notepad)
- `cursor-toys.shareAsCursorToysPlan`: Share as CursorToys (Plan)
- `cursor-toys.shareAsCursorToysHttpFolder`: Share Folder as CursorToys (HTTP Requests)
- `cursor-toys.shareAsCursorToysHttpFolderWithEnv`: Share Folder as CursorToys (HTTP + Environments)
- `cursor-toys.shareAsCursorToysCommandFolder`: Share Folder as CursorToys (Commands Bundle)
- `cursor-toys.shareAsCursorToysRuleFolder`: Share Folder as CursorToys (Rules Bundle)
- `cursor-toys.shareAsCursorToysPromptFolder`: Share Folder as CursorToys (Prompts Bundle)
- `cursor-toys.shareAsCursorToysSkillFolder`: Share Folder as CursorToys (Skills Bundle)
- `cursor-toys.shareAsCursorToysNotepadFolder`: Share Folder as CursorToys (Notepads Bundle)
- `cursor-toys.shareAsCursorToysPlanFolder`: Share Folder as CursorToys (Plans Bundle)
- `cursor-toys.shareAsCursorToysProject`: Share Project as CursorToys (Complete Bundle)
- `cursor-toys.shareViaGist`: Share via GitHub Gist
- `cursor-toys.shareFolderViaGist`: Share Folder via GitHub Gist

### Import Commands
- `cursor-toys.import`: Import from Link (supports: files, bundles, deeplinks, Gists) - Shortcut: `Cmd+Shift+I` / `Ctrl+Shift+I`
- `cursor-toys.importFromGist`: Import from GitHub Gist

### HTTP Request Commands
- `cursor-toys.sendHttpRequest`: Execute HTTP Request
- `cursor-toys.selectEnvironment`: Select HTTP Environment
- `cursor-toys.openEnvironments`: Open HTTP Environments Folder
- `cursor-toys.createEnvironment`: Create New HTTP Environment
- `cursor-toys.initializeEnvironments`: Create Environments Folder
- `cursor-toys.copyCurlCommand`: Copy as cURL Command

### Personal Libraries Commands
- `cursor-toys.save-as-user-command`: Save as Personal Command
- `cursor-toys.save-as-user-prompt`: Save as Personal Prompt
- `cursor-toys.openUserCommand`: Open Command
- `cursor-toys.generateUserCommandDeeplink`: Generate Command Share Link
- `cursor-toys.deleteUserCommand`: Delete Command
- `cursor-toys.renameUserCommand`: Rename Command
- `cursor-toys.revealUserCommand`: Reveal Command in Folder
- `cursor-toys.refreshUserCommands`: Refresh Commands
- `cursor-toys.openUserPrompt`: Open Prompt
- `cursor-toys.generateUserPromptDeeplink`: Generate Prompt Share Link
- `cursor-toys.deleteUserPrompt`: Delete Prompt
- `cursor-toys.renameUserPrompt`: Rename Prompt
- `cursor-toys.revealUserPrompt`: Reveal Prompt in Folder
- `cursor-toys.refreshUserPrompts`: Refresh Prompts

### Skills Commands
- `cursor-toys.openSkill`: Open Skill
- `cursor-toys.generateSkillDeeplink`: Generate Skill Share Link
- `cursor-toys.shareAsCursorToysSkill`: Share as CursorToys (Skill)
- `cursor-toys.deleteSkill`: Delete Skill
- `cursor-toys.renameSkill`: Rename Skill
- `cursor-toys.revealSkill`: Reveal Skill in Folder
- `cursor-toys.refreshSkills`: Refresh Skills

### Notepads Commands
- `cursor-toys.createNotepad`: Create New Notepad
- `cursor-toys.openNotepad`: Open Notepad
- `cursor-toys.generateNotepadShareable`: Share Notepad
- `cursor-toys.deleteNotepad`: Delete Notepad
- `cursor-toys.renameNotepad`: Rename Notepad
- `cursor-toys.revealNotepad`: Reveal Notepad in Folder
- `cursor-toys.refreshNotepads`: Refresh Notepads

### Plans Commands
- `cursor-toys.openPlan`: Open Plan
- `cursor-toys.generatePlanShareable`: Share Plan
- `cursor-toys.deletePlan`: Delete Plan
- `cursor-toys.renamePlan`: Rename Plan
- `cursor-toys.revealPlan`: Reveal Plan in Folder
- `cursor-toys.refreshPlans`: Refresh Plans

### Hooks Commands
- `cursor-toys.createHooksFile`: Create Hooks File
- `cursor-toys.openHooks`: Open Hooks
- `cursor-toys.shareHooks`: Share Hooks
- `cursor-toys.shareHooksViaGist`: Share Hooks via GitHub Gist
- `cursor-toys.deleteHooks`: Delete Hooks
- `cursor-toys.revealHooks`: Reveal Hooks in Folder
- `cursor-toys.refreshHooks`: Refresh Hooks
- `cursor-toys.openHookScript`: Open Hook Script
- `cursor-toys.shareHookScript`: Share Hook Script
- `cursor-toys.shareHookScriptViaGist`: Share Hook Script via GitHub Gist
- `cursor-toys.revealHookScript`: Reveal Hook Script in Folder
- `cursor-toys.deleteHookScript`: Delete Hook Script

### Minification Commands
- `cursor-toys.minifyFile`: Minify File
- `cursor-toys.trimClipboard`: Trim & Minify Clipboard
- `cursor-toys.trimClipboardWithPrompt`: Trim & Minify Clipboard (Select Type)

### Chat Integration Commands
- `cursor-toys.sendToChat`: Send Text to Chat
- `cursor-toys.sendSelectionToChat`: Send Selection to Chat
- `cursor-toys.copySelectionAsPrompt`: Copy Selection as Prompt Link

### Recommendations Commands
- `cursor-toys.checkRecommendations`: Check Recommendations for this Project
- `cursor-toys.browseRecommendations`: Browse Recommendations Marketplace
- `cursor-toys.refreshRecommendations`: Refresh Recommendations Cache

### GitHub Gist Commands
- `cursor-toys.configureGitHubToken`: Configure GitHub Token
- `cursor-toys.removeGitHubToken`: Remove GitHub Token

## Usage Examples

### Example 1: Share a Command
1. Create `.cursor/commands/my-command.md` with your command content
2. Right-click on the file → "CursorToys: Share as Deeplink (Command)"
3. Link is copied to clipboard
4. Share the link with your team
5. Team members press `Cmd+Shift+I` and paste the link
6. File is automatically created in their `.cursor/commands/` folder

### Example 2: Test an API
1. Create `.cursor/http/api-test.req`:
```http
## Get User
GET https://api.github.com/users/octocat
```
2. Click "Send Request" CodeLens link that appears above the request
3. Response opens in a new tab with formatted output
4. Execution time is shown in the tab title

### Example 3: Use Environment Variables
1. Create `.cursor/http/.environments/.env.dev`:
```env
BASE_URL=http://localhost:3000
API_KEY=dev-key-123
```
2. Create `.cursor/http/api.req`:
```http
## Get Users
GET {{BASE_URL}}/api/users
Authorization: Bearer {{API_KEY}}
```
3. Switch environment via Command Palette: "CursorToys: Select HTTP Environment"
4. Select `dev` environment
5. Click "Send Request" - variables are automatically substituted

### Example 4: Share Complete Project Setup
1. Right-click on `.cursor` folder
2. Select "CursorToys: Share Project as CursorToys (Complete Bundle)"
3. All commands, rules, prompts, HTTP requests, and environments are bundled
4. Share the link with your team
5. Team members import with `Cmd+Shift+I` and get the complete setup

### Example 5: Use Inline Variables
1. Create `.cursor/http/api.req`:
```http
# @var API_BASE=https://api.example.com
# @var USER_ID=12345

## Get User
GET {{API_BASE}}/users/{{USER_ID}}

# @var USER_ID=67890
## Get Another User
GET {{API_BASE}}/users/{{USER_ID}}
```
2. Variables are substituted from file-level definitions
3. Section-specific variables override global variables

### Example 6: Use Helper Functions
1. Create `.cursor/http/api.req`:
```http
## Create User with Random Data
POST {{BASE_URL}}/api/users
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "id": "{{@uuid()}}",
  "name": "User{{@randomString(8)}}",
  "age": {{@randomIn(18, 65)}},
  "createdAt": "{{@datetime}}",
  "email": "{{@prompt("Enter email")}}"
}
```
2. Helper functions generate dynamic values at request time
3. `@prompt()` shows input dialog for user-provided values

## Best Practices

### Sharing
1. **Use Deeplinks for small files** (< 2KB) - faster and more compatible
2. **Use CursorToys format for large files** (> 5KB) - no size limits
3. **Use GitHub Gist for maximum compatibility** - works with any editor, browser viewable
4. **Share bundles for team setups** - one link for multiple files
5. **Use project bundles for complete setups** - share entire `.cursor` folder structure

### HTTP Requests
1. **Organize requests by feature** - use markdown sections (`## Feature Name`)
2. **Use environment variables** - avoid hardcoding URLs and keys
3. **Create multiple environments** - dev, staging, prod
4. **Use inline variables for request-specific values** - `# @var` decorators
5. **Use helper functions for dynamic data** - `@uuid()`, `@datetime`, etc.
6. **Use environment decorators** - `# @env` for section-specific environments

### Personal Libraries
1. **Save reusable commands as personal** - available across all projects
2. **Use folders to organize** - drag-and-drop support in tree view
3. **Share personal commands with team** - build a shared library
4. **Use both .cursor and .claude folders** - if working with both editors

### File Organization
1. **Use consistent naming** - descriptive file names
2. **Organize in folders** - hierarchical structure
3. **Use allowed extensions** - `.md` or `.mdc` for commands/rules/prompts
4. **Keep HTTP requests in `.cursor/http/`** - centralized API testing

### Configuration
1. **Set base folder** - customize if using VS Code or other editors
2. **Configure commands folder** - choose `.cursor` or `.claude`
3. **Set default environment** - for HTTP requests
4. **Configure Gist visibility** - public or private by default

## Troubleshooting

### Import Not Working
- Check URL format (deeplink, CursorToys, or Gist)
- Verify file extension is allowed (`cursorToys.allowedExtensions`)
- Check if file already exists (will prompt for overwrite)

### HTTP Request Not Executing
- Verify `curl` is installed and in PATH
- Check file is in `.cursor/http/` folder
- Verify file extension is `.req` or `.request`
- Check environment variables are defined if using `{{variable}}` syntax

### Environment Variables Not Resolving
- Verify environment file exists in `.cursor/http/.environments/`
- Check environment name matches (case-insensitive)
- Verify variable name matches exactly (case-insensitive)
- Check active environment in status bar
- Use `# @env` decorator for section-specific environments

### CodeLens Not Showing
- Verify file is in correct folder (`.cursor/commands/`, `.cursor/rules/`, etc.)
- Check file extension is allowed
- Reload window: `Cmd+Shift+P` → "Developer: Reload Window"

### Tree View Not Updating
- Click refresh button in tree view title
- Or use refresh command from context menu
- File system watchers should auto-update (check if folders exist)

## Technical Details

### Architecture
- **Language**: TypeScript (strict mode)
- **Target**: ES2020
- **Modules**: CommonJS
- **Extension API**: VS Code Extension API
- **Activation**: `onStartupFinished` (ensures all commands available)

### File Structure
```
src/
├── extension.ts                 # Main entry point, command registration
├── deeplinkGenerator.ts         # Generate deeplinks
├── deeplinkImporter.ts         # Import deeplinks
├── shareableGenerator.ts       # Generate CursorToys shareables
├── shareableImporter.ts         # Import CursorToys shareables
├── codelensProvider.ts         # CodeLens for commands/rules/prompts
├── httpCodeLensProvider.ts     # CodeLens for HTTP requests
├── envCodeLensProvider.ts      # CodeLens for environment files
├── httpRequestExecutor.ts      # Execute HTTP requests
├── httpEnvironmentProviders.ts # Environment variable providers
├── environmentManager.ts       # Environment variable management
├── userCommandsTreeProvider.ts # Tree view for personal commands
├── userPromptsTreeProvider.ts  # Tree view for personal prompts
├── userNotepadsTreeProvider.ts # Tree view for project notepads
├── userPlansTreeProvider.ts    # Tree view for plans
├── userHooksTreeProvider.ts    # Tree view for hooks
├── userSkillsTreeProvider.ts   # Tree view for skills
├── hooksManager.ts             # Hooks file management
├── recommendationsManager.ts   # Recommendations system
├── recommendationsBrowserPanel.ts # Recommendations UI
├── gistManager.ts             # GitHub Gist integration
├── minifier.ts                # File minification
├── clipboardProcessor.ts      # Clipboard processing
├── sendToChat.ts             # Chat integration
├── annotationPanel.ts         # Annotation panel
└── utils.ts                  # Utility functions
```

### Key Functions
- `getFileTypeFromPath()`: Detect file type from path
- `getBaseFolderName()`: Get configured base folder
- `getCommandsPath()`: Get commands folder path
- `sanitizeFileName()`: Sanitize file names
- `validateUrlLength()`: Validate URL length (8KB limit)

### Dependencies
- VS Code API: `^1.74.0`
- Node.js: Built-in modules (fs, path, zlib, etc.)
- No external dependencies required
